case_vignette: A 45-YEAR-OLD MAN IS BROUGHT TO THE PHYSICIAN BY HIS WIFE BECAUSE OF DIFFICULTY SLEEPING AND POOR APPETITE FOR THE PAST 4 WEEKS. DURING THIS PERIOD, HE ALSO HAS HAD PERSISTENT SADNESS AND DIFFICULTY CONCENTRATING ON TASKS, BECAUSE OF WHICH HE HAS BEEN REPRIMANDED AT WORK FOR POOR PERFORMANCE. OVER THE PAST 3 YEARS, HE HAS OFTEN HAD SUCH PHASES, WITH A MAXIMUM SYMPTOM-FREE GAP OF ONE MONTH BETWEEN EACH OF THEM. HIS BEHAVIOR IS CAUSING A STRAIN IN HIS RELATIONSHIPS WITH HIS WIFE AND CHILDREN. HIS MOTHER DIED 4 MONTHS AGO FROM BREAST CANCER. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION SHOWS NO ABNORMALITIES. MENTAL STATUS EXAMINATION SHOWS A DEPRESSED MOOD AND CONSTRICTED AFFECT.
question: WHAT IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS IN THIS PATIENT?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Major depressive disorder with persistent depressive disorder (dysthymia)

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing difficulty sleeping and poor appetite for the past 4 weeks.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or energy levels recently?
Yes, I've been feeling persistently sad and have had difficulty concentrating on tasks.
Do you have any past medical history of mental health issues, or have you received any psychiatric treatment before?
I've often had similar phases over the past 3 years, with a maximum symptom-free gap of one month between each of them.
Is there any family history of depression or other mental health disorders?
My mother died 4 months ago from breast cancer, but I haven't mentioned any other family history of mental health disorders.
Have you experienced any significant weight loss due to your decreased appetite?
I haven't mentioned any specific weight loss related to my decreased appetite.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder
